thread.title: Zombies invade Cannes (don't worry - it's just a movie)

title: Zombies invade Cannes (don't worry - it's just a movie)
text:
CANNES, France (Reuters) - Zombies invaded a beach on the French Riviera on Monday.
71st Cannes Film Festival – Photocall for the animation film "Hotel Transylvania 3: Summer Vacation" (Hotel Transylvania 3: A Monster Vacation) out of competition - Cannes, France, May 7, 2018. Film characters pose during a photocall on a pier. REUTERS/Stephane Mahe Dancing to Michael Jackson’s “Thriller”, the undead were not there to eat human brains, but to take advantage of the world’s press gathered a day ahead of the start of the Cannes Film Festival to publicise a movie, “Hotel Transylvania 3: A Monster Vacation”.
The animated comedy follows the adventures of a part-monster, part-human family, on a cruise holiday.
Director Genndy Tartakovsky said he had decided the second instalment of the Sony Pictures franchise would be the last, but was inspired to make a third after his in-laws invited his family on a cruise holiday.
“Who doesn’t want to be on a ship with their in-laws for a week?” he joked with reporters.
“But as I got on the boat I realised: ‘Hey, it’s all about family, and what a great venue for our monster family.’”
The Cannes Film Festival runs from May 8 to May 19.
